title: Exam Xpresss branding assets + frontend build/deploy fixes

requirements.summary: Add clean, watermark-free Exam Xpresss logo as a generated static asset.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean transparent logo file exists at /assets/generated/exam-xpresss-logo-clean.dim_512x512.png.
The generated logo has no visible watermark/artifacts and maintains crisp edges and centered composition.
The generated assets are committed under frontend/public/assets/generated (served statically; not routed through the backend).

file_operations.description: Create/commit the clean transparent Exam Xpresss logo asset (512x512) under static public assets (exported from the provided uploaded logo images, watermark-free).

requirements.summary: Generate favicon/app icons from the clean logo and wire them into the HTML head.
acceptanceCriteria: The following files exist under frontend/public/assets/generated: exam-xpresss-favicon.dim_32x32.png, exam-xpresss-icon.dim_192x192.png, exam-xpresss-icon.dim_512x512.png.
frontend/index.html references the generated favicon and app icons using <link rel="icon"> and apple-touch-icon appropriately.
Browser tab favicon displays the Exam Xpresss icon when running the app.

file_operations.description: Create/commit the 32x32 PNG favicon derived from the clean Exam Xpresss logo (transparent background).
Create/commit the 192x192 PNG app icon derived from the clean Exam Xpresss logo (transparent background).
Create/commit the 512x512 PNG app icon derived from the clean Exam Xpresss logo (transparent background).

Verify/update <head> icon link tags to reference the generated assets at frontend/public/assets/generated/exam-xpresss-favicon.dim_32x32.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/exam-xpresss-icon.dim_192x192.png, and frontend/public/assets/generated/exam-xpresss-icon.dim_512x512.png, including an appropriate apple-touch-icon reference.

requirements.summary: Use Exam Xpresss logo in header branding and remove all 'Caffeine AI' / 'caffeine.ai' UI attribution.
acceptanceCriteria: The header brand mark uses /assets/generated/exam-xpresss-logo-clean.dim_512x512.png and remains responsive with the existing header layout intact.
No visible text/link attribution to 'Caffeine AI' or 'caffeine.ai' appears anywhere in the UI (including the footer).
All user-facing text related to branding is in English.

file_operations.description: Ensure the header brand mark uses /assets/generated/exam-xpresss-logo-clean.dim_512x512.png with responsive sizing and correct accessible alt text; confirm no legacy branding strings remain.

Remove any 'Caffeine AI' / 'caffeine.ai' attribution if present and ensure footer branding text is Exam Xpresss/ExamXpress in English; also replace any brittle dynamic Tailwind class string construction with explicit class mappings to keep styling stable in production builds.
Audit and update any visible branding copy to use Exam Xpresss in English only, removing any 'Caffeine AI' / 'caffeine.ai' references if present.

requirements.summary: Fix frontend issues that contribute to failed build/deployment and ensure stable runtime navigation after deploy.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean install + build completes successfully (frontend build and Motoko canister build).
Deployment/push to network completes successfully without the previously encountered deployment error.
No runtime errors occur on initial load after deployment (home page renders and navigation works).

file_operations.description: Implement a minimal valid React component export (or remove usage and replace imports where applicable) so that TypeScript builds cannot fail due to an empty/invalid module.

Harden initial-load and navigation behavior for deployment: keep the existing in-app navigation model but synchronize the initial page with window.location (and update the URL on navigation) so deployed deep links do not cause runtime errors and navigation works reliably after refresh.

Ensure Tailwind class usage is production-safe by avoiding runtime-generated class strings that may be dropped during build, preventing styling regressions that could be misinterpreted as deployment/runtime failures.
